Question: [Cybersecurity] QID:MC-001 Which are components of the CIA triad? (CHOOSE THREE)
Options:
• A. Accountability
  • B. Confidentiality
  • C. Authentication
  • D. Integrity
  • E. Authorization
  • F. Availability
  • G. Consistency
OptionsWithCorrect:
• A. Accountability
  • B. Confidentiality
  • C. Authentication
  • D. Integrity
  • E. Authorization
  • F. Availability
  • G. Consistency
CorrectOptions:
B, D, F
Why correct: Confidentiality ensures data access only for authorized users, Integrity ensures data accuracy, and Availability ensures data is accessible when needed; these are the three components of the CIA triad.
Why incorrect: Accountability tracks user actions, Authentication verifies user identity, Authorization grants access permissions, and Consistency ensures uniform data states, none of which are CIA triad components.
Rationale: Tests recall of all CIA triad components.
Metadata: Multiple-correct
Source: Section::1.1
Tags: Section::1.1 cybersecurity cia multiple-choice instance-1 multiple-correct

Question: [Cybersecurity] QID:MC-002 Which are components of the CIA triad? (CHOOSE THREE)
Options:
• A. Access Control
  • B. Confidentiality
  • C. Identification
  • D. Integrity
  • E. Availability
  • F. Adaptability
  • G. Isolation
OptionsWithCorrect:
• A. Access Control
  • B. Confidentiality
  • C. Identification
  • D. Integrity
  • E. Availability
  • F. Adaptability
  • G. Isolation
CorrectOptions:
B, D, E
Why correct: Confidentiality ensures data access only for authorized users, Integrity ensures data accuracy, and Availability ensures data is accessible when needed; these are the three components of the CIA triad.
Why incorrect: Access Control restricts system entry, Identification verifies user identity, Adaptability allows system flexibility, and Isolation separates system components, none of which are CIA triad components.
Rationale: Tests recall of all CIA triad components.
Metadata: Multiple-correct
Source: Section::1.1
Tags: Section::1.1 cybersecurity cia multiple-choice instance-2 multiple-correct

Question: [Cybersecurity] QID:MC-003 Which are components of the CIA triad? (CHOOSE THREE)
Options:
• A. Assurance
  • B. Confidentiality
  • C. Integrity
  • D. Containment
  • E. Availability
  • F. Anonymity
  • G. Accuracy
OptionsWithCorrect:
• A. Assurance
  • B. Confidentiality
  • C. Integrity
  • D. Containment
  • E. Availability
  • F. Anonymity
  • G. Accuracy
CorrectOptions:
B, C, E
Why correct: Confidentiality ensures data access only for authorized users, Integrity ensures data accuracy, and Availability ensures data is accessible when needed; these are the three components of the CIA triad.
Why incorrect: Assurance validates security measures, Containment limits incident impact, Anonymity hides user identity, and Accuracy ensures data correctness (overlapping with Integrity but not a CIA component), none of which are CIA triad components.
Rationale: Tests recall of all CIA triad components.
Metadata: Multiple-correct
Source: Section::1.1
Tags: Section::1.1 cybersecurity cia multiple-choice instance-3 multiple-correct

Question: [Cybersecurity] QID:MC-004 Which are categories of security controls? (CHOOSE THREE)
Options:
• A. Operational
  • B. Governance
  • C. Technical
  • D. Compliance
  • E. Managerial
  • F. Monitoring
  • G. Encryption
OptionsWithCorrect:
• A. Operational
  • B. Governance
  • C. Technical
  • D. Compliance
  • E. Managerial
  • F. Monitoring
  • G. Encryption
CorrectOptions:
A, C, E
Why correct: Operational, Technical, and Managerial are three of the four security control categories, addressing procedural security, technological safeguards, and policy management, respectively.
Why incorrect: Governance relates to oversight, Compliance ensures regulation adherence, Monitoring is a security process, and Encryption is a technical control, none of which are distinct control categories.
Rationale: Tests recall of security control categories with plausible distractors.
Metadata: Multiple-correct
Source: Section::1.1
Tags: Section::1.1 cybersecurity security-controls multiple-choice instance-1 multiple-correct

  • G. Managerial

Question: [Cybersecurity] QID:MC-007 What is the primary goal of information security?
Options:
• A. Protecting information and systems
  • B. Enhancing system performance
  • C. Reducing operational costs
  • D. Improving user experience
OptionsWithCorrect:
• A. Protecting information and systems
  • B. Enhancing system performance
  • C. Reducing operational costs
  • D. Improving user experience
CorrectOptions:
A
Why correct: Information security aims to protect information and systems, ensuring their confidentiality, integrity, and availability.
Why incorrect: Enhancing system performance focuses on efficiency, reducing operational costs prioritizes budget, and improving user experience emphasizes usability, none of which are the primary goal of information security.
Rationale: Tests recall of the core objective of information security.
Metadata: Single-correct
Source: Section::1.1

Question: [Cybersecurity] QID:MC-010 What is the primary role of a Security Operations Center (SOC)?
Options:
• A. Developing software applications
  • B. Conducting employee training
  • C. Monitoring and protecting assets
  • D. Auditing compliance requirements
OptionsWithCorrect:
• A. Developing software applications
  • B. Conducting employee training
  • C. Monitoring and protecting assets
  • D. Auditing compliance requirements
CorrectOptions:
C
Why correct: The SOC’s primary role is to monitor and protect critical information assets in an organization.
Why incorrect: Developing software applications is a developer role, conducting employee training is an HR or training function, and auditing compliance requirements is a governance task, none of which are the SOC’s primary role.
Rationale: Tests recall of the SOC’s core function.
Metadata: Single-correct
Source: Section::1.1
